text: hi everyone welcome weird tano here the
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of this new cool kids
album before [ __ ] got weird this is a
brand new lp from the original internet
rap duo the cool kids chuck english and
sir michael rocks are back it has been
years since these two caught a
cross-cultural buzz online in the mid to
late 2000s when i think about that time
it really does feel like forever ago
because the paradigm the cool kids came
up in was so different back then the way
we consume music online the overall
cultural relevancy of hip-hop the
audiences it appealed to we're talking
about a duo here whose first mixtape was
presented by napster these guys recorded
stuff with travis barker while every emo
rapper you could name was still learning
their times tables and your favorite
alchemist collaborator boldy james is
the cousin of chuck english they have
tracks together that are over a decade
old at this point the cool kids
popularity in the 2000s wasn't just by
chance either they had a standout sound
which brought these bassy bangers that
fused together the rudimentary rhythmic
fundamentals of 80s hip-hop with the
modern eccentricities of artists like
the neptunes mike and chuck's relaxed
flows also brought a clash of old and
new as well on tracks such as 88 or a
gold and a pager the duo rode this sound
right up until their 2011 debut when
fish ride bicycles a record that
unfortunately did not really meet the
expectations and quality standards that
the cool kids had set up until that
point and following that they did kind
of fall off the radar as a duo for a
little bit maybe for a combination of
reasons be it the wrong time or the
pressure of making fish ride bicycles
and the fact that it didn't really hit
or navigating an industry that was still
very much shrugging its shoulders at
left field online hip-hop acts or still
struggling to learn how to work with
them think of the very public label
troubles that death grips was having
around this time or odd future being the
most controversial thing under the sun
while still struggling to get
traditional hip-hop publications and
blogs to take them seriously the cool
kids would eventually return in 2017 in
a big way with the release of special
edition grand master deluxe which in
terms of runtime and material was a lot
to go through but i did appreciate the
record going all out in a way that fish
ride bicycles just didn't the production
and features on this thing expanded on
the cool kids sound massively far beyond
a lot of the throwback beats they blew
up on but the rap landscape had evolved
so much over the last six years it was
kind of difficult to see or hear what
exactly made the duo stand out in the
first place which brings us to before
[ __ ] got weird which is a title that
very much acknowledges the position the
duo is in right now not just in terms of
the pandemic but nowadays weird is the
new normal so as a result the cool kids
have no option other than to evolve or
be victims of just sounding regular in
the current music landscape and i think
they make a fair attempt of doing that
here while also throwing it back a
little bit to some of the sounds and
vibes that made them pop off to begin
with some of the tracks here do bring
back some of chuck english's trademark
rugged booming beats that strike that
perfect balance between being lush and
melodic but also skeletal not too busy
scam likely for example which also hits
with all these funny clever narrative
bars about being scammed tricked
deceived the production on strictly
business is like the soundtrack to an
old school house party with bars upon
bars about chilling out relaxing taking
a break taking a breather because you're
making so many mistakes and [ __ ] ups due
to being overwhelmed and just erratic
it's yours part two killer single
features all these reverse drums and
mystical arpeggios mikey's chorus on
this one is one of the best the duo has
done in years meanwhile hibachi sports
these trunk knocking grooves straight
out of the 1980s laced with all these
psychedelic and delayed synth passages
which is kind of the other part of this
lp that makes it stand out in the cool
kids discography it is weirdly
psychedelic and surreal at many points a
vibe that is slightly enhanced by the
skits and transitional moments that
bring us from track to track in a recent
interview i had with the cool kids chuck
english likened his process with
sculpting this project to that of making
a movie and i can definitely feel that
intention through the way much of this
project progresses however that's also a
point of contention i have with this
record too because while it does have a
lot of colorful segues and thematic
connections here and there across the
project there isn't a whole lot of
focus or
linear direction if we pull back and
look at this album as a whole the macro
picture is a little messy i think even
some of the skits here could have used
retooling like showtime for example
which has a lot of things compounding at
once a movie trailer going in a movie
theater walking into the theater being
on the phone at the same time making
noise being interruptive having all
these like little short interactions
from the people surrounding you in the
area there's a lot of weird bits and
sound effects peppered throughout the
skit but it doesn't really reach a
conclusion or punchline of any sort
cells and scales by comparison has a
long-winded intro but is a lot funnier
by comparison especially with how it
ends but the fact that this track is
back to back with the interlude tony two
sweaters uh just kind of further
interrupts what little flow this record
already has going for with 21 tracks on
this entire thing there must have been a
better place to put this so before [ __ ]
got weird is definitely not a trim album
but i suppose it's not the worst problem
to have cause much of the time on this
project it sounds like chuck and mike
are just going wherever their artistic
whims take them which results in a lot
of weird and colorful ear candy there's
the intro track in the mix which has all
these trippy trap beats laced with
synthesizers that make me feel like i am
sitting with mike and chuck as we're
moving through a luxurious acid trip
there's also the theatrical pickup on
line six that has all these eerie soap
opera organs and heavy beats that feel
like something that mf doom and mad lib
would have put together back in the day
on i'm coming over there the heavy
clunky rhythms here pair really well
with the industrial synthesizers and mic
chucks and guap dads whisper wraps and
low sodium is a passionate melodic
anthemic cut that is really enveloping
just beautifully lush some of chuck's
most harmonious production ever with
verse after verse about salt and keeping
it low in your attitude or your diet
left a one star review because they left
out the onions is just one of many stand
out bars on this one that are clever
funny and just kind of get to the point
of the tracks concept really well but by
that same token there are a lot of
tracks here that are so awash in effects
or feature
supremely
low-key supremely disconnected
performances which just prevent the
hooks and the verses from popping as
hard as they maybe should dapper dan
leather for example g-dots feature here
enters the fold pretty unceremoniously
not to mention the mix on mike's verse
on the back end is a little muddy in
comparison with everything else on the
track and the record in general the
chorus on horizon island is no doubt
colorful with all of these layers of
overdubs and synths and sound effects
but they don't really come together in a
way that is all that um
clean so the hook just sounds really
mushy the comatose larry june feature on
this lp as well is maybe just a bit too
laid back putting me in sleepy mode and
ride and clean while sonically it does
sound like a very authentic piece of
classic southern hip-hop with the steady
beats the slo-mo pianos even the pitched
vocals the cool kids really fail to put
a spin on it stylistically as they do
with nearly everything else on this
record not to mention that light work
doesn't really go off in the way that i
hoped it would given it has some of the
biggest and best features on the entire
lp black and jid both of whose
performances here are solid but again
given the name recognition i was more
hoping for fireworks on this one the
record moves into a relatively strong
finish with low sodium that i mentioned
earlier that one's great triumph part
two is a massive banger much in the same
way that it's yours part two was then
warm handshake stuck out to me for a
number of reasons i mean the production
is
super colorful really gummy really fun
the opening flows from mike kind of
calls back to
that classic clips track mr me too while
this song doesn't really tie up the
whole record thematically how could it
with it being so all over the place it
does make sure the album is off as zany
and is out there and as fun as it
started overall i think this lp is the
best full-length album the cool kids
have put out so far which maybe in a
breath does seem odd because this is not
uh maybe the most positive review that
this album could ever get but it's still
a very good project and sees the duo
bringing a level of energy and
creativity that i wished was there on
when fish ride bicycles like 10 years
ago yeah the track list is a little
bloated but there are still lots of
colorful and creative highlights on this
thing and if projects like this continue
to come out i can only hope that chuck
and mike don't continue to be as
underappreciated as historically they
have been feeling a light too decent
seven on this one tran position have you
given this record a listen did you love
it did you hate it what would you rate
it you're the best you're the best what
should i review next hit the like if you
like please subscribe and please don't
cry hit the bell as well over here next
to my head is another video that you can
check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel anthony fantano
the cool kids
forever
